info.title: Blackstone
info.description: The Blackstone codebase is a collection of smart contracts and RESTful APIs which together form the basis for the Agreements Network. This collection includes a full-feature business process execution engine, and high-level translator from BPMN standard to smart contract based process graphs. It also include an object management suite utilized by the Agreements Network.

get.description: Get an Active Agreement Collection.

author.description: Address of the creator (user account or org), logged in user address will be used if none supplied

packageId.description: The packageId of the archetype package from which the collection was created

put.description: Add an agreement to a collection

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Add an agreement to a collection

agreement.description: Address of the agreement to add

collectionId.description: Id of the collection to add to

200.description: Add an agreement to a collection

get.description: Get information for a single Agreement Collection if the author is the authenticated user or the organization the user is a member of.

name.description: Human readable name of the Agreement Collection

author.description: Controller contract of the user or organization

packageId.description: The packageId of the archetype package from which the collection was created

agreements.description: Array of agreement objects included in the collection

get.description: Active Agreement information of agreements that are public, or if the `forCurrentUser` query is set to `true`, a) are authored by the authenticated user, b) are authored by an organization to which the authenticated user belongs, c) include the authenticated user in its signatories, or d) include an organization to which the authenticated user belongs in its signatories

parameters.name: forCurrentUser
parameters.description: Optional query string parameter to get all agreements pertaining to the currently logged in user

name.description: Human readable name of the Active Agreement

archetype.description: Address of the parent Archetype of the Active Agreement

isPrivate.description: Whether the encryption framework of the Active Agreement

attachmentsFileReference.description: Hoard grant needed to access an existing event log if any

numberOfParties.description: The number of parties agreeing to the Active Agreement

name.description: Human readable name of the Active Agreement (limit: 32 ASCII characters)

archetype.description: Address of the parent Archetype of the Active Agreement

isPrivate.description:
Whether the encryption framework of the Active Agreement
is operational or not

password.description:
A secret string which is used to trigger the encryption
system for the Active Agreements's documents

maxNumberOfAttachments.description: The maximum number of attachments to be logged on the Active Agreement

parties.description: The addresses of the parties to the Active Agreement

parameters.description:
The "custom-field-name" and values of the parameters.
Note - If a parameter with type 8 (Signing Party) is given, the corresponding value will be added to the agreement's parties.

governingAgreements.description: If parent archetype has any governing archetypes, agreements for each one must

collectionId.description: Id of the collection that the agreement is intended to be part of if it already exist, and their addresses should be given here.

get.description:
Active Agreement information for a single Agreement.
Notes: - If the password provided is incorrect or a hoard reference which does not exist was passed to the posted Active Agreement this get will return a `401`. - If the agreement was not authored by the logged in user or one of their organizations, or if its signatories does not include the logged in user or one of their organizations, this will return a `404`.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description:
The password to trigger the decryption key for an
opaque Agreement

name.description: Human readable name of the Active Agreement

archetype.description: Address of the parent Archetype of the Active Agreement

isPrivate.description:
Whether the encryption framework of the Active Agreement
is operational or not

maxNumberOfAttachments.description: Max number of attachments that can be stored in the attachments

formationProcessInstance.description: Address of the agreement's formation process instance

executionProcessInstance.description: Address of the agreement's execution process instance

collectionId.description: Id of the collection the agreement belongs to

parties.description: An array of objects with each party member's address, user id or organization name, signature timestamp, and address of the user that has signed for the party

parameters.description: An array of objects with each parameter's name, value, and data type

governingAgreements.description: An array of the governing agreements with the `address`, `name`, and `isPrivate` value of each

put.description: Cancels an agreement if the authenticated user is a member of the agreement parties, or a member of an organization that is an agreement party

an attachment to the specific agreement.
When requested with `Content-Type: multipart/form-data`, the attached file will be uploaded to hoard.
The attachment's content will be set to the hoard grant for the file, and the name will be set to the file's name.
When requested with  `Content-Type: application/json`, the name and content from the request will be used as the attachment.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Add an attachment to an Agreement

name.description: Human readable name of the attachment

attachmentsFileReference.description: The hoard grant of the updated attachments

get.description: archetype information. Within the Agreements Network, Archetypes are the fundamental, top level objects. They are holders for a set of information which allows users to creat Active Agreements within the Platform. The returned list will include archetypes that are: a. authored by the authenticated user, or b. public (ie. `isPrivate` property is `false`) and activated (ie. `active` property is true)

name.description: Human readable name of the Archetype

author.description:
Controller contract of the user or organization
that created the Archetype

active.description:
Whether the Archetype can be used to create
new Active Agreements or not

isPrivate.description:
Whether the encryption framework of the Archetype
is operational or not

numberOfParameters.description: The number of custom parameters used by the Archetype

numberOfDocuments.description: The number of documents registered against the Archetype

countries.description:
The jurisdictions in which the Archetype has been
registered to be active

name.description: Human readable name of the Archetype (limit: 32 ASCII characters)

author.description:
Controller contract of the user or organization
that created the Archetype. Note that currently the author is forced to be the logged-in-user's address
since we do not yet have a review/approval process for changes made to an organization-authored archetype by a user who is part of that organization

description.description: Short human readable description of the Archetype

price.description: Price of the archetype, in cents (Optional- this field can be edited later through a `PUT` request to '/archetypes/:address/price')

isPrivate.description:
**(Optional)** Whether the encryption framework of
the Archetype is operational or not

password.description:
A secret string which is used to trigger the encryption
system for the Archetype's documents

parameters.description:
**(Optional)** The "name" (limit: 32 ASCII characters) and "type" of all custom parameters used
by the Archetype

documents.description:
**(Optional)**  The "name" and "grant" (if any)
sufficient to provide the information regarding the relevant documents associated with
the Archetype

jurisdictions.description:
The "country" and "regions" which the Archetype
has been registered as relevant to. The "country" is registered as an ISO standard
two character string and "regions" is an array of addresses relating to the controlling
contracts for the region (see [ISO standards manipulation](#) section).

formationProcessDefinition.description:
Address of the formation process definition
controller

executionProcessDefinition.description:
Address of the execution process definition
controller

governingArchetypes.description:
Array of contract addresses of the archetypes to govern this new one
of the rights and conditions of the contract

get.description: Gets information for a single archetype package. Returns a `404` if the package is private or not active and the authenticated user is not its author.

name.description: Human readable name of the Archetype Package

description.description: Human readable description of the Archetype Package

author.description: Controller contract of the user or organization

isPrivate.description: Indicates whether the package can be read/used publicly

active.description: Indicates whether the package has been activated and available for creating collections with.

archetypes.description:
Array of archetypes with name, address, and active keys
that are included in the Archetype Package

name.description: Human readable name of the Archetype Package

description.description: Human readable description of the Archetype Package

String.description:
author Controller contract of the user or organization. Will be set to the authenticated user's address if not provided.
that created the Archetype Package

isPrivate.description: Human readable description of the Archetype Package

id.description: id of the created Archetype Package

put.description: Add an archetype to a package

200.description: Add an archetype to a package

put.description:
Activate the archetype package.
An archetype package can only be activated by its author.

Deactivate the archetype package. An archetype package can only be deactivated by its author. Once an archetype package is deactivated by its author, it will not be included  in `GET /archetype-packges` or `GET /archetype-packages/:id` responses  made by users other than the author.

get.description: Get archetype information for a single Archetype. This endpoint will return a `404` if: a. the archetype is not found, or b. the archetype is private and the authenticated user is not its author. Note: if the password provided is incorrect or a hoard reference which does not exist was passed to the posted archetype this get will return a `401`.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description:
The password to trigger the decryption key for an
opaque Archetype

name.description: Human readable name of the Archetype

author.description:
Controller contract of the user or organization
that created the Archetype

active.description:
Whether the Archetype can be used to create
new Active Agreements or not

isPrivate.description:
Whether the encryption framework of the Archetype
is operational or not

parameters.description:
The "name" and "type" of all custom parameters used
by the Archetype

documents.description:
The "name", "grant" (if any)
sufficient to provide the information regarding the relevant documents associated with
the Archetype

jurisdictions.description:
The "country" and "regions" which the Archetype
has been registered as relevant to. The "country" is registered as an ISO standard
two character string and "regions" is an array of addresses relating to the controlling
contracts for the region (see [ISO standards manipulation](#) section).

packages.description: The "id" and "name" of each of the packages that the archetype has been added to

put.description: Set the archetype so that agreements can be created from it.  An archetype can only be activated by its author. This action will fail if the archetype has a successor set.

Sets the successor of given archetype. This action automatically makes the archetype inactive. Note that an archetype cannot point to itself as its successor. It also validates if this action will result in a circular dependency between two archetypes. A successor may only be set by the author of the archetype.
Sets the price of given archetype

Set the archetype so that agreements cannot be created from it. An archetype can only be deactivated by its author. Once an archetype is deactivated by its author, it will not be included in `GET /archetypes` responses made by users other than the author.

get.description: Read Process Models

post.description: XML needs to be passed in the request body as plain text or application/xml

parameters.name: format
parameters.description:
Optional parameter to denote format of process model.
Defaults to `bpmn` which is also the only format that is supported at this time.

200.description: details, process details, and parsed diagram

model.description: with details of the model and processes belonging to it

get.description:
the diagram of the specified process model in the requested MIME type.
The 'Accept' header in the request should be set to either 'application/xml' or 'application/json'.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address of the process model

model.description: with details of the model and processes belonging to it

get.description: Read Content Object
Read Organizations

parameters.name: approver
parameters.description: If the optional query parameter is given causes a JOIN query to retrieve only organizations where the specified user is an approver. Value of 'true' will do the above for the authenticated user.

post.description: Create a new organization also established the primary administrators for that organization. If no approvers are provided for the organization, then the currently logged-in user will be registered as an approver.

approvers.description:
Organization's approvers are the adminsistrators of that organization
and may approve the addition of new users into the organization, set the roles of users within the
organization, as well as remove users from the organization. This array is optional.
If no approvers are passed, the currently logged-in user's address is used as the single
approver of for the new organization.

get.description: Read a Single Organization

put.description: Updates an existing organization. Accepts a new name. Authorizes organization approvers.
a new department within an organization and add members to it

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Create a New Department in an Organization

users.description:
Addresses of the members to add to the Department
If not given, department will be created with no members and members can be added later

200.description: address of the Organization, the id and name of the department, and the users belonging to the department

users.description: Addresses of the members to add to the Department.

get.description: Read Countries
Get the country whose `alpha2` code matches the one passed as parameter.

Get an array of regions belonging to the country
whose `alpha2` code matches the one passed as parameter. Note that a
region may have its `code2` OR `code3` property populated, NOT both.
Thus to represent regions in the UI dropdown, we can use
`<alpha2>-<code2 or code3>` followed by the name.
Read Currencies

Get the currency whose `alpha3` code matches
the one passed as parameter.
Read Parameter Types
Read Single Parameter Type
Read Collection Types

Get user information. The `organization` query
parameter is optional. It can be used to filter users belonging to a
specific organization or retrieving users not belonging to an
organization, yet (via `?organization=null`).

Note: The organization address is returned as
"0000000000000000000000000000000000000000" for user that do not
belong to an organization.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description:
If the optional parameter is given
filters users accordingly. May give the API the following options
`<orgAddress>|null|notnull`

isProducer.description: Set to true to create a producer account instead of a consumer account (optional)

get.description: Get a single users profile identified by the access token.

isProducer.description: Boolean representing whether user account is producer type (as opposed to consumer type)

onboarding.description: Boolean representing whether user prefers to see onboarding screens

put.description: Update a single users profile identified by the access token.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Update User Profile of currently logged in user

currentPassword.description: User's current password (optional if new password not being set)

isProducer.description: Set account type to producer or consumer(optional)

onboarding.description: Set user preference for viewing onboarding screens (optional)

get.description: Validates the JWT `access_token` which should be set as cookie in the request.

post.description: Send an email with a password recovery code to the given email address.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Request password reset for a user account

200.description: Request password reset for a user account

get.description: if the given password recovery code is valid

200.description: Validates the given password recovery code

put.description: Reset the users password with the given password, if the recovery code is valid.

get.description: Activate the user account.
